questions.question: Which statistical measure provides a measure of central tendency for a dataset?
questions.clue: It represents the average value of the dataset.
questions.explanation: The mean is a statistical measure of central tendency that represents the average value of a dataset. It is calculated by summing all the values in the dataset and dividing it by the number of observations.

questions.question: Which statistical measure describes the spread or dispersion of a dataset?
questions.clue: It quantifies the variability between data points.
questions.explanation: Variance is a statistical measure that describes the spread or dispersion of a dataset. It quantifies the average squared deviation of each data point from the mean. A higher variance indicates a greater spread of the data.

questions.question: Which statistical measure is resistant to outliers?
questions.clue: It represents the middle value of a dataset.
questions.explanation: The median is a statistical measure that represents the middle value in a dataset when arranged in ascending or descending order. It is resistant to outliers because it is not affected by extreme values.

questions.question: Which statistical test is used to determine the relationship between two continuous variables?
questions.clue: It measures the strength and direction of the linear relationship.
questions.explanation: A correlation test is used to determine the relationship between two continuous variables. It measures the strength and direction of the linear relationship between the variables, providing a correlation coefficient that ranges from -1 to 1.

questions.question: Which statistical measure is used to assess the spread of a dataset around the mean?
questions.clue: It quantifies the average distance between data points and the mean.
questions.explanation: Standard deviation is a statistical measure used to assess the spread of a dataset around the mean. It quantifies the average distance between each data point and the mean, providing a measure of the dispersion of the data.
